verses.roman:
dui-jane khaṭmaṭi lāgāya kondala
tāṅra prītyera kathā āge kahiba sakala

synonyms: dui-jane—two persons; khaṭmaṭi—fighting over trifles; lāgāya—continued; kondala—quarrel; tāṅra—his; prītyera—affection; kathā—narration; āge—ahead; kahiba—I shall speak; sakala—all.
translation: They sometimes appeared to fight over trifles, but these quarrels were based on their affection, of which I shall speak later.
